data.title: Better error message when trying to load a tga image
data.body:
I tried to import a COLLADA file referencing a texture in TGA format. Godot brings up an error saying that the image could not be found. I first thought that something is wrong with the path. However, as soon as I changed the format to PNG everything worked.

So I suggest to re-write the error message to something like "Image format not supported".

data.title: UI inconsistencies with Plugin nodes selection/deselection
data.body:
**Issue description:**
Special dock options (like with the Path2D node) that should only be shown when the plugin node is selected are kept showing even when you "reset" selection by clicking on an empty space on the canvas. If the plugin node is a Control node, the "Anchor" button on the upper tab of the editor will disappear, but not docks manually handled with handles(object) and make_visible(visible).
Also, when you select said Plugin Node with the mouse selection box, the special dock won't appear - even when the plugin is the only node being selected. As the previous example, if the plugin node is a Control node, the "Anchor" option will appear - but not any of the docks handled with handles(object) and make_visible(visible).

Hopefully I could describe those inconsistencies well. They are not Engine-breaking, but when creating a Plugin Node, they look like annoying bugs for the user.

**Link to minimal example project:**
Linking a small project with a plugin + custom dock example.
[ui-problem.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/861695/ui-problem.zip)

data.title: Collision shapes overridden in inherited scenes are not used by physics, but display fine.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1, built recently from Github's 2.1 branch.


**Issue description:**
Collision shapes overridden in derived nodes are not used by the physics. They are, however, displayed fine both in the editor and in game with the 'visible collision shapes' option enabled.

Further inspection confirms that the NodePath of the collision shape does point to the base scene's resource while the game is running.

The expected behaviour is of course that the scenes use their own collision shapes when overridden.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a scene with a `KinematicBody2D` root, and a `CollisionShape2D` helper node. In that node, create a `CircleShape2D` resource of radius 32. Save as `A.tscn`

Create an `A.tscn` inherited scene, `B.tscn`. In the inherited `CollisionShape2D` node, create a new `CircleShape2D` resource of radius 16. Save.

Create `Main.tscn`and instance both A and B. Turn on visible collision shapes. Both the editor and running game will show the expected collision shapes. But B will still reference A's collision shape, as you can test with any collision.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[InheritedSceneResources.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/859115/InheritedSceneResources.zip)

Remember to turn on visible collision shapes when testing this project. That sprite following the mouse cursor will turn red when over a shape, I figured it'd make the issue easier to see.

If you take a peek at the console, I've printed the shape resources' NodePaths. You'll notice that the NodePath of both shapes are identical.

data.title: Show 3D raycasts when debugging collisions
data.body: Addresses #3172 . In addition, change the color of a raycast when a collision occurs.

data.title: Parity between iOS and Android 9dof sensors
data.body:
I'm hoping someone who has got both an Android phone and Apple phone can diagnose this further then I can at this moment. 

Now that we have accelerometer, gyroscope and magnetometer data working on both iOS and Android in both Godot 2.1 and 3.0 it looks like the coordinate systems do not line up and the devices have a different idea of what "down" is.

If there is someone who has both devices it would be good if they could put the devices side by side and compare the output of these sensors in different orientations of the device.
This project outputs raw data to screen (amongst others) and could be used to test this:
https://github.com/BastiaanOlij/testCoreMotion

If I get my hands on a suitable android phone I will certainly do this myself.
Note that PR #8100 contains a small fix to make the magnetometer give output for iOS.

data.title: Fixing magnetometer on iOS
data.body:
This must be the tiniest PR I've done so far :)

This adds one extra parameter to starting device motion on iOS that enables reading out the magnetometer. 

I'm not out of the woods yet, the results returned seem weird, maybe someone else can have a look and see if they can make sense of it. My suspicion is that the magnetometer is the only output iOS does not adjust for device orientation and the counter adjustments currently done are therefor wrong.

I'll be doing more work on this in the coming few days to nail this :)

data.title: Add editor option for automatically closing the output when stopping the game (2.1)
data.body: (back-ported from 1bd1af776c111f1efdd9a3b0259d8f916c052ef2)

data.title: Suppress error messages when using ConfigFile::get_value and a default is given
data.body:
Fixes #8097

Not sure if I should remove the if on lines 86-89 (`if(!p_default`)) thought..

data.title: ConfigFile::get_value error reporting
data.body:
I am ConfigFile::get_value and it takes a default value. The problem is it reports an error if it decides to use this value, which is what I would expect it to do!
So it is working as one would expect yet throwing out errors or warnings.
I keep seeing errors as I run my game yet it is working perfectly as expected.

Can we stop this method from reporting the false errors?

data.title: Editor FileSystem defualts to unfolded folder structure
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.2 official. Windows 10 x64 pro

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
The FileSystem folder structure defaults to unfolded.

**Steps to reproduce:**
In the editor look under the filesystem. Navigating away causes the folder structure to unfold. 

**Link to minimal example project:**
It's kind of annoying when looking for assets and everything is unfolded no matter how many times I refold all the folders.

data.title: Fix random crashes when using yield()
data.body:
e8611966de4dfc9c28a7a4de1798f3f10ff87f80 intended to replace indexed operator by pointer arithmetic, but in the way altered the meaning of the code in a subtle way.

I was getting random crashes at random places where I was using `yield()` heavily.

This PR makes everything work again, while keeping the intent of the referred commit.

~UPDATE: Getting crashes now on Android. Looking deeper...~

UPDATE: **Now it's fixed.** I had got lost in the expression and my first attempt was wrong, more or less the same that happened to the original author. @hpvb, If only there were GPS for these, don't you think? :)

data.title: Fix random crashes when using yield() (2.1)
data.body:
e8611966de4dfc9c28a7a4de1798f3f10ff87f80 intended to replace indexed operator by pointer arithmetic, but in the way altered the meaning of the code in a subtle way.

I was getting random crashes at random places where I was using `yield()` heavily.

This PR makes everything work again, while keeping the intent of the referred commit.

UPDATE: Getting crashes now on Android. Looking deeper...

UPDATE: **Now it's fixed.** I had got lost in the expression and my first attempt was wrong, more or less the same that happened to the original author. @hpvb, If only there were GPS for these, don't you think? :)

data.title: AnimationTreePlayer: animation blend/mix slider is not working in the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
In Godot 2.1 everything is working fine. In Godot 2.1.1 bug is present already.


**Issue description:**
Blending is working properly in Godot 2.1: 
![blend_good](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6129594/24119250/d05dcae2-0db0-11e7-962c-885d43fbdf1f.gif)

Since Godot 2.1.1 it's not working anymore:
![blend_bad](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6129594/24119261/dc246f7a-0db0-11e7-938f-0280e5587765.gif)

Also this is an editor bug, during runtime everything seems to work fine, so it might be possible it's just something with ui of blend/mix node.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Download Platformer 3D demo
2. Open "Player.scn"
3. Select AnimationTreePlayer node
4. Try to change animation blending in "gun" node of Animation Tree Player


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Convert to MeshLibrary creates an empty .tres file
data.body:
using the master on manjaro 16, I'm finding that the Scene -> Convert To... -> MeshLibrary function produces a file that looks like this


    [gd_resource type="MeshLibrary" format=2]

    [resource]


meanwhile I am using a .tscn file to generate the mesh library that follows the pattern described in the docs

data.title: Fix Particles2D process mode back-compat issue (2.1)
data.body:
Since scene files before `process_mode` was introduced don't have a value for that, particle systems don't get its `set_process_mode()` called.

This workarounds that by forcing it to be called.

Fixes #8089.

data.title: Godot 2.1.3 pre-stable can change the monitoring status of Area2D scenes
data.body:
**Ubuntu 16.10 - Godot version: pre-2.1.3 from https://github.com/GodotBuilder/godot-builds/releases/tag/2.1_20170319**


**Issue description:**
Opening projects with area based scenes on the tree, can change the "monitoring" value for no apparent reason, scene files appear with "monitoring = false" on the tscn where they are added but the inspector shows "checked" mark and works fine (as if monitoring is true) on 2.1/HEAD 
Opening back in 2.1.2 gives the expected result of all scenes with monitoring disabled.


**Steps to reproduce:**
I have no idea how to trigger the issue on a small project, appears to affect only Area2D scenes added as child of a scene.
A way to see the issue could be editing a scene file to change the monitoring status to false, it should appear as true/checked on the editor.

data.title: Particles2D fails sometimes - 2.1.3 pre-stable
data.body:
**Ubuntu 16.10 - Godot version: pre-2.1.3 from https://github.com/GodotBuilder/godot-builds/releases/tag/2.1_20170319**

**Issue description:**
Sometimes Particles2D does not emit particles.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open and run a project with many (instanced in runtime?) particle emitters.

**Link to minimal example project:**
Player bullets on the platformer demo are a good example.

data.title: Android gravity vector Godot 2.1
data.body:
This PR adds support for reading the gravity vector sensor. This is a vector the OS calculates from the accelerometer sensor with some nice math to filter out any user vibration/movement. It is very useful in getting a more accurate "down" vector for stabilizing device orientation or for getting an approximate user movement by subtracting this vector from the accelerometer output.

Mainly it's added to create parity with the core motion changes we did for iOS for issue #7503 

In theory the test project I did for coremotion should work to test this as well:
https://github.com/BastiaanOlij/TestCoreMotion

Due to lacking a suitable android device that actually has these sensors I've not been able to actually test this so I'm hoping someone with device that has all 3 sensors could give this a go?

And since @akien-mga refactored half the 2.1 branch this probably works in Godot 3 too.

data.title: Preparing for 2.1.3-stable
data.body:
It's time to work on stabilising the 2.1 branch again so that we can release 2.1.3-stable.

2.1.2 was two months ago, and since 3.0 is taking its time, many devs have pushed some development work to the 2.1 branch directly, so we'll need to do some more extensive testing - we have more than just bug fixing commits :)

This issue is meant to gather initial feedback on pre-release binaries, so that we can spot regressions (either from new developments or from bad cherry-picks I might have done).

You'll find binaries from yesterday here: https://github.com/GodotBuilder/godot-builds/releases/tag/2.1_20170319

Known issues:
- CanvasItemEditorPlugin tries to access `set_position` instead of `set_pos`: fixed in 4230b22 (but not in above binaries)
- CanvasItemEditorViewport tries to connect to non-existing CheckBox signal: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/a9d8da91b72fe8493f9087563056bb4ade4ca2c7#diff-3910e354cfb3848e417581c47035e5c5R3777
- Something was fishy with iOS templates in 2.1.2-stable? Help welcome to know exactly how the zip should be setup.
- add yours :)

Note: as always I'm only interested in *regressions* (i.e. bugs that did not affect earlier 2.1.x versions), including to some extent bugs in new features if there are any. Packaging issues with the templates, etc., are of course also interesting :)

data.title: [godot 3.0] ImageTexture embedded into scene file
data.body:
I have exposed in my C++ plugin a Ref<ImageTexture> and allowed this to be set in the editor for my heightmap terrain. 

Now when i set this heightmap in my scene and save it, it saves the texture it references INTO the scene, causing my scene to be around 40MB, and once closed is now no longer openable!

changing to Ref<Texture> works fine, so really the question is, should an ImageTexture be allowed to be embedded in the tscn?

data.title: Can't call methods or access properties with names identical to GDScript keywords
data.body:
*bugsquad edit: * Original title was: "**Can't call VisualServer.sync()**"

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.2 / 3.0

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
`VisualServer.flush()` is renamed to `sync()` at b524b40fdc5325c840192ce92dbed8108ccef2d9
And `sync` became a keyward for high level network function.
So, now, `VS.sync()` makes error `Expected identifier as member`

**Steps to reproduce:**
```gdscript
func _ready():
    VS.sync()
    VS.call("sync") # workaround
```

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Pixel bleeding in Tilemaps with filtering enabled
data.body:
Godot 2.1.2 x64 Linux kubuntu 16.10

When enabling filtering for tilesets, you can see bleeding from neighboring tiles on edges. For example
![sc-06_25_34-2003](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/24088682/1274593a-0d36-11e7-8db0-342149b005f8.png)
You can clearly see that pixels from white tile above are bleeding into the one displayed.

Steps to reproduce: 
1. Create a tilemap from tileset with filtering enabled.
2. Paint tiles that have differently colored neighbors to see the bleeding.

data.title: Semantic versioning for Class API and modules
Crash when opening default lighting config dialog
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Xubuntu - Godot 3.0 (master)


**Issue description:**
When i wanted to change the default lighting on a 3D project the engine crashed with a segfault, i found the exact reason for this but could not fix it since i have no idea of what the value of these variables are suposed to be:
crash happens in rasterizer_scene_gles3.cpp line 3066:
glBindFramebuffer(GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER, storage->frame.current_rt->effects.mip_maps[0].sizes[0].fbo);
the reason of the crash is because storage->frame.current_rt->effects.mip_maps[0].sizes is a null Vector<MipMaps::Size>

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open a new, or any project, go to Spatial Editor and open the View menu and select Configuration

data.title: Vector2 literals with swapped signs
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
FreeBSD, 9061d6f8ce8c393653204b7565d7af3fe0c3c084

**Issue description:**
```
func _init():
	Vector2(3, -2)
	print(Vector2(-3, 2))
```
This code prints `(3, -2)`. Expected is `(-3, 2)`.
Doesn't occur in 2.1.2

data.title: [3.0][Feature] Highlight properties
data.body:
Since we got properties in 3.0, it would be nice to highlight them in the script editor (like class names), because it's hard to tell them apart from local variables. Or more generally, highlighting member variables could be of great help (Visual Studio and Eclipse do that and its very handy).

Screenshot of current state:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311555/24083376/29cacb1a-0cd6-11e7-9eab-11af530bd7c7.png)
Here, `transform` is actually a class property, 
`_roll` and `stabilizer_speed` are custom members.

data.body:
In [Atom](https://atom.io/) you can change selected text to Upper/Lower Case

data.title: Feature Request: Multiple variable in one line
data.body:
In python you can set variable like this:

`a, b, c, = 1, 2, 3`

I think It is useful in godot.

`var forceJump, jumpCount, MAX_JUMP_COUNT = 500, 0, 2`

data.title: Implement C dynamic plug-in interface [WIP]
data.body:
Based on the discussion and proposed (by @reduz) solution at #3936

I'm still trying to complete implementing all methods declared at original [godot_c.h](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/3936#issuecomment-228582342), but, as I'm not that familiar with the internal C++ API, I would like to ask for some guidance while doing it.
